etymology.description: 来(來) (lái, "come") + 吧(吧) (ba, "modal particle indicating suggestion or urging") = come on.
etymology.interpretation: The word 来吧(來吧) (lái ba, "come on") is a colloquial phrase used to invite or urge someone to come or proceed with something. It combines the idea of coming with a casual or encouraging tone, thanks to the particle 吧(吧) (ba, "modal particle").

parts.english: modal particle indicating suggestion or urging

examples.chinese: 一切准备就绪(一切準備就緒)，来吧(來吧)。
